page.title: 06Billericay Railway Station
page.content: Built in 1888.Ten people work there.A new waiting room and supervisor's office with computer to show trains' positions are being built.4 to 5 thousand commuters use trains in rush hours.{Average daily takings}Â£7000. {Ordinary day}return to Liverpool Street,London, Â£5.80.{Cheap day}in off-peak time, Â£3.80.{Yearly season {ticket}Â£863. 12 to 15{passenger trains}an hour stop hour, 6 in off-peak times.Fast trains have maximum 12 carriages,semi-fast 4 to 8.First{passenger train}to London leaves 02.41, last 23.34. There are 2 {postal trains}a day and several {goods {trains}mainly carrying coal or frozen food.Is{Red Star}station, ie. parcels delivered same day anywhere in U.K.
